p: Other lyssaviruses may cause a clinically indistinguishable syndrome to classical rabies; these are usually spread by bats. Rabies presents with an acute viral encephalomyelitis, and the case fatality rate approaches 100%, as there is no effective medical treatment once the disease has taken hold. Most rabies cases are reported in Africa and Asia, and there are estimated to be around 60,000 deaths a year worldwide [ 29].
